alert.note: Alert for Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 20 at 3:35AM MDT until June 20 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 7 PM MDT TODAY FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS DUE TO LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Hot, dry, and unstable conditions will return today. Breezy to locally windy southwest to west winds will combine with low relative humidity to create several hours of critical fire weather for the northeast highlands. Any fires that develop will have the potential for rapid fire growth in receptive fuel beds. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 1 PM this afternoon to 7 PM MDT this evening. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Highlands (Zone 123) from 1 pm to 7 pm today. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with occasional gusts to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values of 10 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended..
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
